column3: Nah I think it makes sense to backport this in preparation for 0.13. Maybe mention in the release notes? Not sure how many people rely on this programmatically.\n
Updated the release notes just to be safe.\n
Nothing specific, just lack of review and testing as usual with backports.\nI'll take a look at it.\n

Eh, breaking API compatibility in a bugfix release? I don't see any real benefit to this. If people want the new API, they can just use 0.13. We've never broken API compatibility before in even a major release... now isn't the time to do it in a bugfix release. :/\n

The idea would be to have the same API on 0.12 and 0.13, which makes e.g. testing easier (also for e.g. segwit).
But I don't care deeply whether this makes it into 0.12...

You do have a point that this would be an API-breaking change in a minor releaese.
Closing this, apparently it is controversial\n
Nit: usually we call this category "RPC low-level API changes"\nhttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v0.12.0/doc/release-notes.md#rpc-low-level-api-changes\n
